page.title: 15Housing
page.content: Most of the old houses in Port Isaac are down by the harbour and are made from cob slate and stone.They were made from these materials because they could be dug up from the ground and concrete was not invented. All the windows on the old houses are small, as well as the doors and the ceilings low.Most of the houses in the old part of the town are terraced and the streets are narrow,especialy squeezy belly alley because it is the narrowest public thoroughfare in the world.Many of the old cottages are now holiday cottages. All the new houses are at the top of the village.The building materials are concrete,tiles and asbestos.Houses built now are mostly bungalow and many of them are detatched.They have big windows and big gardens and the streets are wider.
